alert.note: Alert for Boone; Calhoun; Carroll; Cerro Gordo; Crawford; Emmet; Franklin; Greene; Hamilton; Hancock; Hardin; Humboldt; Kossuth; Palo Alto; Pocahontas; Sac; Story; Webster; Winnebago; Worth; Wright (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 13 at 9:15PM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Blizzard and Poor Travel Conditions This Evening... ...Life Threatening Wind Chills into Early Next Week... .Northwest winds will continue to cause near-blizzard to blizzard conditions across portions of central Iowa and to the north and west. Significant drifting remains likely in rural areas and especially west to east roads. The northwest winds have ushered in Arctic cold air with current temperatures well below zero and wind chills in the 30s and 40s below zero. This extreme Arctic air combined with breezy to strong winds will continue to create dangerous temperatures and wind chills through early next week, with wind chill values as low as 45 below zero possible at times. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...Much of central Iowa. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until midnight CST tonight. For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility and cause whiteout conditions at times. Significant blowing and drifting of snow will cause some roadways to become impassable. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Although blizzard conditions are expected to end by midnight, minor blowing and drifting snow and existing unplowed drifts will continue to produce hazardous travel in some areas overnight.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
